userRequest.example: The original task description or copywriting request.

channel.example: The channel or platform the copy is intended for.

product.example: The product or service the copy is about.

targetAudience.example: A description of the target audience.

toneOfVoice.example: A description of the desired tone of voice.

brandGuidelines.example: Summary of key brand voice and style rules.

example.product_details: A detailed description of the product's features.

language.example: The language the copy should be in.

draftCopy.example: The generated initial draft of the copy.

draftRevisionNotes.example: A justification for the choices made while generating the draft, always in English.

consolidationRevisionNotes.example: A description and justification of how the various inputs were consolidated, always in English.

brandRevisionNotes.example: Summary of changes made to align the copy with brand guidelines, always in English.

channelCopy.example: The reviewed copy optimized for the channel.

channelRevisionNotes.example: Summary of changes made to optimize copy for the channel, always in English.

productCopy.example: The reviewed copy with integrated product details.

productRevisionNotes.example: Summary of changes made to integrate product details, always in English.

targetAudienceCopy.example: The refined copy adjusted to be most appealing to the target audience.

targetAudienceRevisionNotes.example: Summary of changes made to tailor the copy for the target audience, always in English.

toneOfVoiceCopy.example: The refined copy adjusted to match the requested tone of voice.

toneOfVoiceRevisionNotes.example: Summary of changes made to match the requested tone of voice, always in English.

brief.example: The text of the project brief.

briefData.example: Any data related to the project brief.

briefFiles.example: List of files related to the project brief. (Contents sent separately.)

briefFolderId.example: The ID of the Google Drive folder containing the project brief.

briefFolderUri.example: The URI to the Google Drive folder containing the project brief.

example: Optional additional information about the brief and the project in general.

example.relevance: Why this matters for the specific deliverables requested
example.production_impact: Specific explanation of how this blocks production

example.relevance: Why this matters for the specific deliverables requested
example.production_impact: How this affects quality or efficiency

example.relevance: Why this matters for the specific deliverables requested
example.production_impact: Specific explanation of how this blocks production

example.relevance: Why this matters for the specific deliverables requested
example.production_impact: How this affects quality or efficiency

xratecardData.example: The full rate card (asset types, tier definitions, rates).

ratecardId.example: The ID of the Google Drive file containing the rate card.

ratecardFile.example: Optional: The file containing the rate card. (Contents sent separately.)

ratecardData.example: Optional: The full rate card (asset types, tier definitions, rates).

inputGaps.example: The list of gaps in the brief.

example.number: The number of requested deliverables of this type, use a plain number, not a string
example.asset_name: Provided asset name or label, leave blank if not provided
example.asset_type: One of the following values: 'TV Spot' (may also appear as 'spot', 'OLV', 'Social Video', or 'TVC'), 'Static Banner', 'Social Static', 'HTML Banner', 'Print', 'Retouching' (use when brief says 'image update' or 'print update' and refers to changes like color correction, cleanup, or part replacement), 'Radio Spot', 'Audio', 'Standard Banner HTML', 'Rich Media Banner', 'Other'
example.placement: The placement of the deliverable, e.g. 'In-Feed' or 'Story'
example.duration: Choose from: '6 seconds', '10 seconds', '15 seconds', '30 seconds', 'Other', or leave empty
example.creative_base: Classify as 'Adaptation of an existing visual' if the brief mentions reusing, resizing, adapting, or working from an existing asset, reference, or master file. Classify as 'New creative' if the brief calls for a new concept, design, or no reference to prior work. If unclear or not applicable, return 'Other'>
example.changes_needed_on_creative_base: Modifications as stated in the brief. Example: 'Update product imagery and legal supers'
example.asset_copy: One of: 'Client provides final copy', 'Include exact copy', 'New copywriting requested', 'Not needed', or leave empty if not specified
example.technical_specifications: Include exact dimensions, file formats, platform specs, safe zones, resolution, weight limits if provided. leave empty if not specified
example.channel: Choose from: 'YouTube', 'Instagram', 'Facebook', 'Snapchat', 'TikTok', 'Display Network', 'Print', 'Website', 'In-store', 'Other', or leave empty if not specified
example.delivery_deadline: Format as 'YYYY-MM-DD' if exact date is given, or leave empty if not specified
example.target_audience: Verbatim from the brief, or leave empty if not specified

xdeliverablesId.example: The ID of the Google Drive file containing the deliverables.

example.normalized_asset_type: The asset type as it occurs in the rate card
example.normalization_reasoning: A justification for why normalized_asset_type was chosen to match asset_type

example.complexity_tier: Very Simple | Simple | Medium | Complex | Other
example.complexity_reasoning: A justification for why the chosen `complexity_tier` was selected

historicalTimelines.example: Historical timelines for this client for reference.

historicalTimelinesFolderId.example: The ID of the Google Drive folder containing the historical timelines.

example.rate: The corresponding rate for the deliverable, based on the rate card and the number of assets. Use a plain number, not a string.

quoteData.example: The previously generated quote per asset.

startDate.example: The start date of the project.

endDate.example: The end date of the project.
